column4: HELP ~ I've put a civ2 CD in my laptop and now I can't eject the disc tray on my laptop :(
umount the CD first, then press eject
tried it, it gives me an error message saying theirs no media
Can you see the CD in a file manager?
when I go to Places > COmputer it shows a DVDRW Drive
first close all file dialogs and terminals that are using the drive, secondly, right click on the DVDRom drive and click unmount
tried, it only allows me to "Mount VOlume" and "Eject"
When you click "eject", does it eject?
it says "There's probably no media in the drive"
You can kill an unresponsive program with ^C
You can kill an unresponsive program with ^c
Yes, Ctrl-c, or mostly written as ^c terminates the process you are currently running in your terminal.
didn't do anything =/ either way it didnt fix the problem, I tried kiling all wine processes too
try lsof /dev/sdc5 <<- Substitute this sdc5 with the proper device-name for your DVD-rom drive
try lsof | grep '/dev/sdc5' <<- Substitute this sdc5 with the proper device-name for your DVD-rom drive
